Below are some common statistical definitions:

-   Population: Any complete collection of observations or potential observations

-   Sample: Any smaller collection of actual observation from the population

-   Random Sampling: A procedure designed to ensure that each potential observation in the population has an equal chance of being selected in a survey

-   Random Assignment: A procedure designed to ensure that each person has an equal chance of being assigned to any group in an experiment

-   Homogeneity: Similarity among individuals within a population

-   Parameter: A descriptive measure of the characteristics calculated on a population

-   Sample statistic: A descriptive measure on a sample
